item.title: Godfather Android malware now uses virtualization to hijack banking apps
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new version of the Android malware "Godfather" creates isolated virtual environments on mobile devices to steal account data and transactions from legitimate banking apps. [...]

item.title: Webinar: Stolen credentials are the new front door to your network
item.dc:creator: BleepingComputer
item.description: Cybercriminals no longer need zero-days to breach your systems—these days, they just log in. Join BleepingComputer, SC Media, and Specops Software's Darren Siegel on July 9 at 2:00 PM ET for a live webinar on how attackers are using stolen credentials to infiltrate networks and how you can stop them. [...]

item.title: OpenAI’s Sam Altman discusses GPT-5 release date
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: ChatGPT's next big upgrade, or the new foundational model "GPT-5," is still being prepared for a release in the summer, but OpenAI won't share the specifics. [...]

item.title: US recovers $225 million of crypto stolen in investment scams
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice has seized more than $225 million in cryptocurrency linked to investment fraud and money laundering operations, the largest crypto seizure in the history of the U.S. Secret Service. [...]

item.title: Special Webinar: Key Insights from Verizon’s 2025 DBIR
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by LayerX
item.description: GenAI, credential theft, third-party risks—Verizon's 2025 DBIR reveals what's putting your org at risk. Join DBIR author Alex Pinto & LayerX CEO Or Eshed as they break down this year's key insights and defense strategies. Don't miss the webinar—register now. [...]

item.title: Microsoft unveils new security defaults for Windows 365 Cloud PCs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has announced new Windows 365 security defaults starting in the second half of 2025 and affecting newly provisioned and reprovisioned Cloud PCs. [...]

item.title: ChatGPT will analyze Gmail emails, manage schedule on Google Calendar
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: ChatGPT appears to be testing support for Gmail and Google Calendar integration. This will allow users to summarise emails and create events. [...]

item.title: DuckDuckGo beefs up scam defense to block fake stores, crypto sites
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The DuckDuckGo web browser has expanded its built-in Scam Blocker tool to protect against a broader range of online scams, including fake e-commerce, cryptocurrency exchanges, and "scareware" sites. [...]

item.title: Telecom giant Viasat breached by China's Salt Typhoon hackers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Satellite communications company Viasat is the latest victim of China's Salt Typhoon cyber-espionage group, which has previously hacked into the networks of multiple other telecom providers in the United States and worldwide. [...]

item.title: Krispy Kreme says November data breach impacts over 160,000 people
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: U.S. doughnut chain Krispy Kreme confirmed that attackers stole the personal information of over 160,000 individuals in a November 2024 cyberattack. [...]

item.title: Ryuk ransomware’s initial access expert extradited to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A member of the notorious Ryuk ransomware operation who specialized in gaining initial access to corporate networks has been extradited to the United States. [...]

item.title: Pro-Israel hackers hit Iran's Nobitex exchange, burn $90M in crypto
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The pro-Israel "Predatory Sparrow" hacking group claims to have stolen over $90 million in cryptocurrency from Nobitex, Iran's largest crypto exchange, and burned the funds in a politically motivated cyberattack. [...]

item.title: North Korean hackers deepfake execs in Zoom call to spread Mac malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: North Korean advanced persistent threat (APT) 'BlueNoroff' (aka 'Sapphire Sleet' or 'TA444') are using deepfake company executives during fake Zoom calls to trick employees into installing custom malware on their computers. [...]
